comment: The absolute worst teacher I have had at KSU.  His ego is all that fits in the class there is very little room for any learning left. This class has the potential to be great but his personality and teaching style destroy any chance of the class being truly usefull. There is no real organization and he rarely posts grades in a timely fashion.

Avoid this guy like the plague!!! He is very arrogant. He answers all questions with smart comments as if you are already supposed to know the material. Yes of course you read before class but once you are in class he teaches none of it.Taking this class would be a big mistake. You will regret it!!!

I've heard horror stories about this Prof.Yes, he can be arrogant.However, once you get past the arrogance, he is very fair and has a lot of interesting things to say. He has a lot of real world experience and tries to make sense of very difficult material. If you want to learn and enjoy challenges, take him. Take as a Maymester rather than normal.

This is class material is difficult, but Prof. Schulzke really works to keep it interesting.  He is extremely knowledgeable and he really tries to help his students to be ready for the CPA Exam.  Is the class easy?...NO, but you will learn a lot from Prof. Schulzke.  I would highly recommend him.

I made an A in this class despite the professor. He is arrogant, and never directly answers a question. The exams are take home and most people still fail. Budget at least 7 hours for each exam. One good thingâ€¦ he will adjust exam grades if you provide good arguments for "wrong" answers. Overall, avoid this professor if at all possible.

Nightmare and you do not have a choice on the Professor. This should be a very interesting class but we were stressed out all the time...I cannot even explain my level of frustration in the class. All reviews on this Professor are true.

"You can't learn negotiation from a book."  Your grade is based on your performance in the simulated negotiations with other students.  Of the 5 main strategies, you probably suck at 3 of them.  Taking this class WILL  IMPROVE YOUR ABILITY.  It is extremely helpful!  It should be required for an MBA.

Worst professor I've ever had by a longshot. Makes students pay for his own mistakes. Doesn't teach 50% of the material on the tests.  Self-absorbed doesn't come close to describing his attitude.  Seriously paranoid and doesn't trust anyone.  Disorganized and unstructured. Take anyone but Schulzke, you'll thank me.

Exams do not fairly test your understanding of material.  50%, give or take, of questions on his 2 exams are like scavenger hunts.  No way to prepare for these questions.  You search, while taking the timed exam(s), through the book/his articles/online for verbatim answer(s). Got a B(89%) no curve in spite of request for curve and +/- in syllabus!

This was the worst class I have ever had at KSU! No doubt he is a smart guy. The book was hard read, the exams were take home but near impossible to get an A. I was happy to just get a C just so I didn't have to retake the class. The only accounting class I haven't gotten an A in, missed a B by 1 point.

Wow, this guy is the most self-important person I have ever met. Basically told anyone who disagreed with him about anything that they were a moron. Took off points if you asked questions which he felt were unimportant (seriously -2 from your final grade). Unfortunetaly only prof for ACCT 4300 at KSU; otherwise avoid at all costs as you will pay.
He will destroy you like an academic ninja.

Class had some *very* useful parts, but also a lot of theoretical junk. Schulzke knows his stuff, but adds little to the class; grading & feedback is untimely. Final is hard& little useful learned from studying for it. Shell book is very good. Schulzke fails to provide organizaiton in group projects-frustraiting.Worth taking, but short of potential

I did not like this class.  Unstructured, unprepared.  No feedback.  Even final grade was a "conservative estimate", i.e the projects were never graded.  I still do not know how well or bad I did with my research.  I would not recommend this class.
Class is interesting.  A lot of group work.  Mid-term and a Final.  2 projects.  Only drawback you aren't really ever sure where you stand with your grade until its all over
